data.title: Exploring Almost Forgotten Gravesites in the Great State of Ohio: OHIO CEMETERY PLAT MAPS
data.meta_description: A blog about exploring almost forgotten gravesites in Ohio and preserving gravesites and gravestones.
data.text:
Ohio WPA CEMETERY PLAT MAPS

county-BY-COUNTY listing

Angie King

Telephone: (419) 586-4232 x.241

Fax Number: (419) 586-3541

101 North Main Street, Room 203

Celina, Ohio 45822

October 4, 2018

Adams County Recorder

110 West Main Street Room #133

West Union, OH 45693

937-544-5051 & 937-544-2513

Hours: Monday – Friday 8:30a.m. to 4:00p.m.

Attention: Mark Tolle

Adams website through Ohio Recorders website: https://www.ohiorecorders.com/adams/

Per conversation with Becky (Rebecca) Reed, phone number: 937-217-1897 on October 4, 2018, the original WPA Cemetery Plat Maps are at the Recorder’s Office. She said that they are not bound in a book but are loose papers. She mentioned that Mr. Mark Tolle is the recorder and the person to contact.

Spoke to Mark Tolle on October 5 2018. The Recorder’s Office has the originals available to view and photograph. He said that they are not recorded documents. He also stated that their office no longer has the individual veterans’ grave cards. That they were turned over to the Adams County Historical society.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Adams County Historical Society

The Adams County Heritage Center

The Adams County Historical Society

507 N. Cherry St.

West Union, Ohio 45693

Phone: 937-544-8522

between 12:00 - 4:00 P.M. Thursday and Saturday

Adams County Genealogical Society

The Adams County Heritage Center site is located on St. Rt. 247 at 507 North Cherry St. in West Union, Ohio.

The center includes a genealogical collection, museum, post office, and log house.

This is open on Thursday and Saturday from 12:00 P.M. - 4:00 P.M.

For more information about the center, call 937-544-8522 during those normal open hours.

Photographic copies of all of the original WPA Cemetery Plat Maps that continue to remain at the Adams County Recorder’s Office were made in 2018 and reduced in size to fit into a 8-1/2” x 11”notebook. Becky mentioned Margaret Moss who lives in Kansas was involved with this project.

Unfortunately, the maps do not show veterans’ names, their burial location on the map, nor their war service record. The “box” for the Wars Legend was drawn but without any information in it.

Becky also sent me an email on October 4th, 2018. This was in response to my email to the Adams County Genealogical Society (email of:ACGSoh@yahoo.com) sent on October 3, 2018. Also on October 4, 2018, Becky sent an email with photographs of a couple of Adams County WPA Cemetery Plat Maps. Unfortunately, no veterans’ names or burial locations are written on the maps. See below.:

Barbara Schaab, Ashtabula County Recorder

Hours for researching: 8:00a.m. to 4:15p.m. They are located in the Ashtabula County Courthouse and you will need to go through security first.

Subject:WPA Cemetery Plat Maps for Butler County

1930s era drawn maps - perhaps in a large bound book

Good morning!

We do have a cemetery plat book, but it does not include veteran burial information. This book is just the layout of the cemetery plots.

We do however have a Veteran Grave Registration Search that would allow someone to search where a particular veteran is buried. This search is available on our website.

I hope this helps!

Update for Clermont County – August 30, 2017

Nick Hoover

Deputy Recorder

Clermont County Recorder’s Office

513-732-7236

“We should have a plat for every cemetery on that list.

We do have Veteran Grave Registration Cards and also some other older soldier records including the burial records and discharges.

I am unsure of how complete the series is because I have never had to retrieve them and they are stored offsite. Let me know if it is something you are interested in searching through. We can arrange to have them ready to view.”

Nick Hoover shared the WPA Cemetery Plat Map page for the Nazarene Cemetery now known as the Old Baptist Cemetery (and a “Colored Cemetery” is also on the same page) on page 42 found in the Clermont County WPA Cemetery Plat Map book. He also shared a map with locations of cemeteries in Clermont County as well as an Index to all of the cemeteries in Clermont County with numbers that correspond to the map.

Update October 16, 2018:

County Archivist

Cuyahoga County Archives

3951 Perkins Avenue

Cleveland, OH 44114

Judith G. Cetina, Ph.D. -

jcetina@cuyahogacounty.us

216-443-7250 (phone)

216-443-3636 (fax)

archive@cuyahogacounty.us

Researchers are welcome to visit Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays, from 8:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Address is 3951 Perkins Ave. Cleveland, OH 44114. Free parking is available on E. 40th St. facing the building.

You will use the Perkins Ave. entrance (around the corner) and enter the vestibule. You will see an intercom and should choose the option for the Archives - 3rd floor.

On the same panel you will see a button with a bell imprinted on it. When you press it you will be connected to someone on the Archives staff. That person will "buzz" you in and you will proceed through the double doors and straight ahead into the lobby and then slightly to the right. You will see the elevator and take it to the third floor where you will enter into the Archives space.

When you come in please request to see the Cemetery Plat Map on microfilm. No appointment is necessary.

The Archives does have in its holdings both microfilm and hard copies of the Cemetery Plat Map for Cuyahoga County. As the original record is somewhat fragile the staff will ask you to use the copy on microfilm.

The Archives has one volume for Cuyahoga County; and it includes a large index map that identifies all of the cemetery locations in the County, and that map is followed by individual pages for the various cemeteries. The cemetery maps only document the names and burial sites for veterans of the Revolutionary War, War of 1812, Spanish American, WWI, etc.

The Archives staff can make copies of the relevant pages from the microfilm, and if legible I would attach them to an email communication. If it appears that paper copies are easier to read I would send them by U.S. mail to your address. Please let me know which option is best for you and the staff will act accordingly.

Judith G. Cetina, Ph.D., CA archive@cuyahogacounty.us

**********

19. DARKE COUNTY OHIO

Friday, October 4, 2013

Darke County Engineer dce@earthlink.net

We have no WPA Cemetery plats in our office. We do have plats of township cemeteries that show the lot layouts and some names of lot owners. However there is no designation for veterans. Sorry we can’t be more help.

Darke County Engineer’s Office

~~~~~~~~~~

October 2, 2013

Garst Museum

205 North Broadway

Greenville, OH 45331

Phone #: 937-548-5250

Fax# : 937-548-7645

“We have a set of the WPA maps of the cemeteries. These maps just have the markings/numbers of the grave where the veteran is buried, and no names on the maps. I did see a small cemetery where names were on the page.

We also have notebooks with all the burials of the Civil War veterans listed with the grave # and cemetery information. I am now also getting the 1812, Mexican and Spanish Am. veterans copied and typed up. (from the grave registration cards at the Recorders office) I hope to get those typed up in a couple of weeks but can check my notes for any of those burials.

The WPA maps are rather large and may be difficult to copy. Some of the smaller cemeteries would be easy to copy. I think we got our maps from the Engineers office.”

Sincerely,

Phyllis Crick, librarian

Darke County Research Center at Garst Museum

21. DELAWARE COUNTY OHIO

October 11, 2013

Jack Jennings, P.S.

Supervisor

Map Department (DCMD)

Delaware County Engineer

740-833-2450 (Delaware)

740-548-7313 (Columbus)

(See address information below)

www.delawarecountyengineer.org

“Our cemetery record sheets are bound in a large book. We do have a few miscellaneous prints stuck in with them. Back in the late 1960's and up to maybe ten (10)years ago, they were available for copying. A little over six (6) ago, the county engineer asked me to serve as the map department supervisor and, at that time, I started scanning the pages. I can now print a copy from the digital file I created (which we are required to charge a nominal fee for) or I can, in my opinion, now justify providing a PDF or TIF formatted file(s) at no charge ... because (again, in my opinion) there are no copier or supplies expense involved in providing the "digital copy" to the general public. And, often times, folks just want them to view or for reference only, anyway. And, of course, as I'm sure you know, since those formats are so standard now, especially PDF, folks can always print them at home, if they want.

Our office is located in the Rutherford B. Hayes Administration Building, on the 1st floor, at 140 North Sandusky Street and our hours are 8am to 5pm, Monday thru Friday, except holidays (we are open Columbus Day, also). I always suggest that visitors who are not familiar with our area actually use an address of "140 North Union Street" in their navigation units, which directs them much better to the actual available parking and entrance to the building.”

**********

Also,

Ohio Historical Society:

August 16, 2013

Collection. Franklin County veterans grave registration cemetery plats. circa 1800-1940. [State Archives Series 7515]

Creator: United States. Works Progress Administration of Ohio.; Franklin County (Ohio). Recorder.

Extent (quantity/size): 62 microfiche.

Media: Microfiche

Location/Public Access Data: FCH 128

Scope and Content

These plat drawings show the location of soldiers' graves in various cemeteries in Franklin County. The drawings were done as part of the Works Progress Administration of Ohio Official Project #465-42-3-467 and #665-42-3-232, which were co-sponsored by Adjutant General Gilson D. Light and the American Legion Department of Ohio. Veterans served from the American Revolution through World War I.

Includes Agudath Achim Cemetery, Alton Cemetery, Arlington Park Cemetery, Amaranth Abbey Cemetery, Camp Chase Confederate Cemetery, Central Cemetery, Concord Cemetery, Eastlawn Cemetery, Evergreen Burial Park, Forest Lawn Cemetery, Galloway Cemetery, Glen Rest Cemetery, Grove City Cemetery, I.O.O.F. Dublin Cemetery, Jefferson Township Cemetery, Maplewood Cemetery, Memorial Burial Park, Mifflin Cemetery, Mr. Calvary Cemetery, Oak Grove Cemetery, Obetz Cemetery, Otterbein Cemetery, Pioneer Cemetery, Riverside Cemetery, Silent Home Cemetery, St. Joseph Cemetery, Union Cemetery, Union Grove Cemetery, Walnut Grove Cemetery, Wesley Chapel Cemetery, Franklin Hills Memory Garden "Garden of the Christus," and Glen Rest Memory Estate as well as various smaller cemeteries.

Lisa

Research Services Department

Ohio Historical Society

800 E. 17th Ave.

Columbus, OH 43211-2474

614-297-2510

reference@ohiohistory.org

**********

From: "Heise, Robin" rheise@co.greene.oh.us

To: 'Linda Jean Limes Ellis' <ljellis_2000@yahoo.com>

Sent: Monday, October 22, 2018 12:42 PM

Subject: RE: WPA Cemetery Plat Maps

Hi Linda,

Thank you for your email. We do have a WPA Cemetery map book for Greene County, here at the Archives. It is listed on our full inventory, under the Recorder’s Office. The plat map has not been digitized, but it is available to view if you visit the Archives.

One day we hope to make these available online, however, there are other projects ahead of that on our long digitization list.

If you would like to visit the Archives in order to view the map, we are open Monday thru Friday, 9 AM to 4:30 PM.

If you are unable to visit the Archives, please let me know what information you are looking for and we will do our best to get it to you.

Thank you and have a good day.

Robin

Robin Heise

Records Manager/Archivist

Greene County Records Center and Archives

535 Ledbetter Road, Xenia, OH 45385

Tel: (937) 562-6489

Fax: (937) 562-6485

War Veterans’ Graves, Record of; 1 volume, 1824 – 1986

WPA Veterans’ Graves Registration (Plot Maps); 1 volume (oversize) , dated 1939

32. HANCOCK COUNTY OHIO

October 29, 2013

Hancock County Engineers Office

1900 Lima Avenue

P.O. Box 828

Findlay, Ohio 45839-0828

Phone #: 419.422.7433

Fax #: 419.424.5057

Kevin C. Coppler wrote on October 29, 2013 that the Hancock County Engineer’s Office does have Hancock County Cemetery Plat Maps. They are not WPA Cemetery Plat maps, however, they appear to be more recently drawn maps and show the plot owner names in boxes that denote with the lot number for the locations of burials.

These maps do not have veteran listings, however, but the maps are well drawn and may be of help to researchers. Contact the Hancock Engineer’s office directly for more information. They have scanned their maps in large .pdf formats.

Hancock County Engineers

CADD Manager

45. LICKING COUNTY OHIO

December 3, 2013

Licking County Genealogical Library

101 West Main Street

Newark, OH 43055

Phone #: 740-349-5510

Located within the Licking County Public Library:

Hours open at the genealogical library:

Tuesday through Saturday – 1:00p.m. to 4:00p.m.

Wednesday Evening – 4:00p.m. to 7:30p.m.

Thanking Susan Leininger of the Ohio Daughters of the War of 1812 for informing me that the Licking County Genealogical Society has the WPA Cemetery Plat Maps for Licking County. The maps are at the genealogical society’s library located within the main Licking County Library in Newark.

On December 4, 2013 spoke by phone to volunteer, Terry, at the Licking County Genealogical Library. He said that the WPA Cemetery plat map pages are encased in plastic and are quite large.

He said that the pages can be copied on 11” x 17” paper in sections. The photocopy costs are 25 cents per 11” x 17” and 15 cents for 8-1/2” x 11” size paper.

See the listing below for their genealogical collection including:

“B – West Wall of Library 7. Map of Cemeteries Grave Registration of Licking County.”

Ruth Osborn, Librarian – January 2, 2014:

So you can put on under Licking County that the Licking County Genealogical Society has copies of the Licking County WPA maps of cemetery plat maps of veterans graves. The is a total of 125 pages that are the cemeteries map and veterans name and location on the map. The pages are 16” x 24” and we have no way to photo copy that large of pages.

We can copy sections of the maps but not the whole page on one page. Our Library is open Tuesday and Thursday 12:00 to 4:00, Wednesday 1:00 to 7:30, Friday and Saturday 1:00 to 4:00.

We have made up from the graves registration cards 10 books in alphabet order of the Licking County, Ohio Veterans that has their name, address, date of death/ place, cause of death, date of birth/place, names of cemetery location, lot, next of kin, war served date enlisted, date discharged branch of service, company, outfit or ship. Copies of these are at library .15 cent each or mailed for $2.00 each.
